intro: Aztecaster, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the genus Tithonia and is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its large, bright orange or yellow flowers and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in warm climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Aztecaster is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
